list_definition.definition: (only with itas subject) to rain in small drops

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The rain gradually slowed to a light drizzle.

list_ex_of_english: The weather was rather cold with a heavy drizzle.
Being a hot month there is no rain, yet drizzle can occur rarely.
The overcast skies often are accompanied by fog and drizzle, though usually not rain.
Observations suggest that when marine stratus is present alone, drizzle is minimized.
Weather at the time of departure was a 3kn mph wind and light drizzle that did not significantly restrict visibility.
Rain is very common, sometimes torrential though often settling to days of drizzle.
Although the weather was mainly overcast and there was occasional drizzle, everyone was in good spirits and there was generally a good atmosphere.
Drizzle is normally produced by low stratiform clouds and stratocumulus clouds.
